extends CommonBase
implements Constraint

    • Method Detail

      • and

        public Constraint and(Constraint c)
        Returns an "AND" Constraint. The Constraint "AND" is satisfied if both of the Constraints "this" and "c" are satisfied. The Constraint "AND" is not satisfied if at least one of the Constraints "this" or "c" is not satisfied.
        Specified by:
        and in interface Constraint
        Parameters:
        c - the Constraint which is part of the new "AND" Constraint
        Returns:
        a Constraint "AND" between the Constraints "this" and "c2".

      • asBool

        public VarBool asBool()
        This method returns a Var variable that is equal 1 if the constraint is satisfied and equals 0 if it is violated. Each constraint that participates in logical expressions should implement this method.
        Specified by:
        asBool in interface Constraint
        Returns:
        Var with a domain [0;1]: a 1 value indicates the constraint is satisfied, a 0 value indicates the constraint is violated.

      • implies

        public Constraint implies(Constraint c)
        Returns a Constraint that states the implication: if this then c. In other words, if this constraint is satisfied, then constraint "c" should also be satisfied.
        Specified by:
        implies in interface Constraint
        Parameters:
        c - the Constraint in the implication.
        Returns:
        a Constraint that means "if this then c".

      • negation

        public Constraint negation()
        Returns a Constraint that is satisfied if and only if this constraint is not satisfied.
        Specified by:
        negation in interface Constraint
        Returns:
        a Constraint that is satisfied if and only if this constraint is not satisfied.

      • or

        public Constraint or(Constraint c)
        Returns an "OR" Constraint. The Constraint "OR" is satisfied if either of the Constraints "this" and "c" is satisfied. The Constraint "OR" is not satisfied if both of the Constraints "this" and "c" are not satisfied.
        Specified by:
        or in interface Constraint
        Parameters:
        c - the Constraint which is part of the new "OR" Constraint
        Returns:
        a Constraint "OR" between the Constraints "this" and "c".

      • post

        public void post()
        This method takes a constraint's implementation and uses its own RI-specific post-method.
        Specified by:
        post in interface Constraint
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if a failure happened during the posting

      • post

        public void post(ConsistencyLevel consistencyLevel)
        This method is used to post the constraint. Additionally to post() this methods specifies a particular level of consistency that will be selected by an implementation to control the propagation strength of this constraint. If this method is not overloaded by an implementation, it will work as a post().
        Specified by:
        post in interface Constraint
        Parameters:
        consistencyLevel -
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if a failure happened during the posting

      • post

        public void post(java.lang.String name,
                 Probability probability)
        This method is used to post the constraint assuming that it can be violated. The parameter probability defines a probability that this constraint will not be violated. If it's ALWAYS this is the same as a regular constraint posting. If it's NEVER, the posting of this constraint will fail producing a RuntimeException. All other values allow the constraint to be violated with certain penalties. For instance, probability LOW invokes higher penalty to compare with probability HIGH, but a lower penalty to compare with VERY_LOW. The Problem' method getTotalConstraintViolation() returns a variable that could be minimized to find a solution that may all synchronize all relative constraint violations. Thus, posting related constraints with different probabilities may resolve their conflicts.
        Specified by:
        post in interface Constraint
        Parameters:
        name - of the constraint
        probability -
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if a failure happened during the posting
